Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • thefinalpackage.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Thread
    Keeps track of the robot`s x,y position and its heading theta.
    Author:
    DPM team 01

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        public Odometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
        EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
        EV3LargeRegulatedMotor upperMotor)
        Constructor for the odometer class. Takes in 4 parameters
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - the robot`s leftMotor
        rightMotor - the robot`s rightMotor
        INTERVAL - the interval at which it updates the odometer (in milliseconds)
        autostart - tells it if it autostarts or not

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position,
               boolean[] update)
        sets the x,y and theta values of the odometer to the values stored in the array.
        Parameters:
        position - the x,y and theta values to be updated to
        update - boolean array that tells whether or not to update the value(x, y, theta)

      • getPosition

        public void getPosition(double[] position)
        stores the position (x,y,theta) in a double array
        Parameters:
        position - the array that stores the position : x is index 0, y is index 1, theta is index 2

      • getPosition

        public double[] getPosition()
        returns the position (x,y,theta) in a double array
        Returns:
        the position in a double array : x is in index 0, y is in index 1, theta is index 2

      • getMotors

        public EV3LargeRegulatedMotor[] getMotors()
        returns an array containing the left and right motors
        Returns:
        an array that has stored the leftMotor in index 0 and the rightMotor in index 1 and upperMotor is index 2
